Function Documentation

ARQuaternion ARQuaternionSphericalWeightedAverage ( int  n,
const ARQuaternion  quaternions[],
const double  weights[],
double  errorTolerance,
int  maxIterationCount 
)

Estimates the spherical weighted average of a set of quaternions. This algorithm may issue unexpected results if the quaternions are not on the same hemisphere.

Parameters:
n the number of quaternions
quaternions the quaternions.
weights the weight for each of the quaternions.
errorTolerance the desired accuracy.
maxIterationCount the maximum number of iterations after which the algorithm is cancelled, returning a estimate that is less accurate than the tolerance. Used as a safeguard against (semi) infinite loops.
Returns:
The spherical weighted average.
ARQuaternion ARQuaternionSphericalWeightedAverageInternal ( int  n,
const ARQuaternion  quaternions[],
const double  weights[],
ARQuaternion  initialEstimate,
double  errorTolerance,
int  maxIterationCount 
)

Estimates the spherical weighted average of a set of quaternions. This algorithm may issue unexpected results if the quaternions are not on the same hemisphere.

Parameters:
n the number of quaternions
quaternions the quaternions.
weights the weight for each of the quaternions.
initialEstimate the initial estimate of the result. Must be a unit vector.
errorTolerance the desired accuracy.
maxIterationCount the maximum number of iterations after which the algorithm is cancelled, returning a estimate that is less accurate than the tolerance. Used as a safeguard against (semi) infinite loops.
Returns:
The spherical weighted average.
ARQuaternion ARQuaternionWeightedSum ( int  n,
const ARQuaternion  quaternions[],
const double  weights[] 
)

Compute the weighted sum of a set of quaternions, by computing a weighted sum of all elements individually.

Parameters:
n the number of quaternions.
quaternions the quaternions. Must be of length n.
weights the weights for each of the quaternions. Must be of length n.
Returns:
the resulting sum.

Variable Documentation

const ARQuaternion ARQuaternionIdentity = {1, 0, 0, 0}

Identify quaternion [1, 0, 0, 0]. Note that quaternions have two identity quaternions, since identity represents the same rotation as -identity.

const ARQuaternion ARQuaternionZero = {0, 0, 0, 0}

A quaternion with every coordinate set to 0.
